title: cmd/go: cross compiling for arm produces a warning
body:
Cross compiling this program for linux/arm
```
package main

func main() {
	print("hello world\n")
}
```
Produces a warning
```
% GOARM=6 GOOS=linux GOARCH=arm go build -v hello.go
runtime
command-line-arguments
# command-line-arguments
warning: unable to find math.a
```
However the final binary still links and runs properly.

1. The go tool, or linker should not produce a warning, it should be an error.

2. math.a is being added to the dep chain unconditionally, see 891d344cd0b9c43b6dc89a0920c57442b93326cf, but maybe this needs to be more nuanced.
